channel.title: [pi] Bows & Mutes
channel.description:
It appears I have hit a road bump.
I have both an IP mute and normal mute command that succesfully add players user name and IP to text files. What I need now is to know how but mostly wher to find and restict players talking to unmuted players only.
My second problem is that I wanted to add a new bow to my PI server but cannot find where to add the ID so that it requires and fires arrows.
Any help is appretiated. (just remeber, it's a PI server, not delta!!!!!)

item.title: [pi] Bows & Mutes
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:8, topic:365920”][quote author=staypuff link=topic=462117.msg3380886#msg3380886 date=1288019794]

Well - I’m guessing what you mean is that not only do you not want the muted players talking but you also don’t want players talking to the muted player.

I’m not sure if this would work but, there’s a boolean in the Player (Or PlayerHandler) class called chatTextUpdateRequired - This boolean - if true - sends a request to the client to update the chat text for that player.

Maybe (Not saying this will work) if you check if the player is muted and set the chatTextUpdateRequired to false then the player wont be able to see any chat text.

Also; Make a backup before trying this.

Actually what I meant is that my mute commands add peoples names to a txt file list bit they can still talk. Idk where to find the code for when people talk.
[/quote]
Oh…

What I need now is to know how but mostly wher to find and restict players talking to unmuted players only.

Heh. Sounds (to me) like you didn’t want players talking to muted players.

And well, what you need to do is find packet 4 I think it is (The chat packet) check if the player is muted using an if statement, if so return.

if(muted) {
    // Send a message or something here if you like.
    return;
}

Obviously - You’ll need to change it to do exactly what you want and change if muted variable to yours.[/quote]

Ummm ok. But heres the thing, I don’t just have “isMuted” Infact there isn’t even a line for that in my char files. Instead, like I previously said twice now I think, I have all my muted players names and/or IP’s in a .txt file list.

Here is my chat packet.

package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
import server.Connection;

/**
 * Chat
 **/
public class Chat implements PacketType {

	@Override
	public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
		c.setChatTextEffects(c.getInStream().readUnsignedByteS());
		c.setChatTextColor(c.getInStream().readUnsignedByteS());
        c.setChatTextSize((byte)(c.packetSize - 2));
        c.inStream.readBytes_reverseA(c.getChatText(), c.getChatTextSize(), 0);
		if (!Connection.isMuted(c))
			c.setChatTextUpdateRequired(true);
	}	
}

How would I change… say this:

if (!Connection.isMuted(c))

To read the names from the text file (or IP’s) and then stop them from talking if they are on the list?

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] Bows & Mutes
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

So steve, that if statement. If I copied that would it work? Or do I need to add more to it.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] Bows & Mutes
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“staypuff, post:7, topic:365920”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=462117.msg3380878#msg3380878 date=1288019118]
Well - I’m guessing what you mean is that not only do you not want the muted players talking but you also don’t want players talking to the muted player.

I’m not sure if this would work but, there’s a boolean in the Player (Or PlayerHandler) class called chatTextUpdateRequired - This boolean - if true - sends a request to the client to update the chat text for that player.

Maybe (Not saying this will work) if you check if the player is muted and set the chatTextUpdateRequired to false then the player wont be able to see any chat text.

Also; Make a backup before trying this.
[/quote]

Actually what I meant is that my mute commands add peoples names to a txt file list bit they can still talk. Idk where to find the code for when people talk.[/quote]
Oh…

staypuff:

What I need now is to know how but mostly wher to find and restict players talking to unmuted players only.

Heh. Sounds (to me) like you didn’t want players talking to muted players.

And well, what you need to do is find packet 4 I think it is (The chat packet) check if the player is muted using an if statement, if so return.

if(muted) {
    // Send a message or something here if you like.
    return;
}

Obviously - You’ll need to change it to do exactly what you want and change if muted variable to yours.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Well - I’m guessing what you mean is that not only do you not want the muted players talking but you also don’t want players talking to the muted player.

I’m not sure if this would work but, there’s a boolean in the Player (Or PlayerHandler) class called chatTextUpdateRequired - This boolean - if true - sends a request to the client to update the chat text for that player.

Maybe (Not saying this will work) if you check if the player is muted and set the chatTextUpdateRequired to false then the player wont be able to see any chat text.

Also; Make a backup before trying this.
